edu.usm.cos420.assignment1.view.impl

Class OrderMenuView

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.usm.cos420.assignment1.view.impl.OrderMenuView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MenuView

    public class OrderMenuView
extends java.lang.Object
implements MenuView
    View class to display and receive order menu choices

      • displayMainMenu

        public void displayMainMenu()
        Display menu options to user
        Specified by:
        displayMainMenu in interface MenuView

      • getMainMenuChoice

        public int getMainMenuChoice()
        Read the menu choice from the user

        Method will not return until a valid choice has been made

        Specified by:
        getMainMenuChoice in interface MenuView
        Returns:
        • 1 : add an order to the system for the customer
        • 2 : list all orders for the customer
        • 3 : list orders in date range
        • 0 : exit the order menu

      • getIdInput

        public int getIdInput()
        Get user input for an Order ID
        Returns:
        either a valid Order ID or 0 if the user wishes to abort the operation

      • abortAdd

        public void abortAdd()
        Inform user they are aborting an Order add

      • getItemIdInput

        public int getItemIdInput()
        Get user input for an InventoryItem to add to the Order
        Returns:
        a validly formatted InventoryItem ID. Will not have been checked for existence in the InventoryRepository. May return 0 if the user wishes to abort the Order

      • itemNotFound

        public void itemNotFound(int itemId)
        Report to user that the InventoryItem could not be found
        Parameters:
        itemId - the ID of the InventoryItem

      • getItemQuantityInput

        public int getItemQuantityInput()
        Prompt user for quantity of an item to order
        Returns:
        the quantity to order or -1 if they wish to abort

      • invalidQuantity

        public int invalidQuantity(int quantityToOrder,
                           int quantityInStock)
        Report to user that the quantity requested is invalid
        Parameters:
        quantityToOrder - the quantity requested
        quantityInStock - the quantity actually in stock
        Returns:
        calls getItemQuantityInput() to attempt to get valid input

      • orderConfirm

        public boolean orderConfirm(Order newOrder)
        Ask user to confirm placing the order
        Parameters:
        newOrder - the Order to be placed
        Returns:
        true if the user wishes to place the order, false otherwise
